subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Bill, with respect, I imagine only Kent and Erich can answer that question. The last time I asked Kent that question, his answer indeed had to do with
messageBody:
Bill de h√ìra wrote:

> Sorry but this argument to slowness is bunk. Saying Junit is stuck
> on 3.8.1 because of a concern for featuritis isn't credible imo.

Bill, with respect, I imagine only Kent and Erich can answer that
question. The last time I asked Kent that question, his answer indeed
had to do with featuritis. ("I wanted JUnit to be the intersection of
all common requirements.") Now granted, I probably asked over a year
ago, but at least that's one data point for an actual reason.

I find that whenever I guess at someone's motivation, I'm wrong.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
